title: Different Machine Learning Algorithms
narration: Welcome This video will explore different machine learning algorithms providing an overview of their functionalities and applications. We will delve into the core concepts that drive these powerful tools used in various industries.

title: Supervised Learning
content:
Learning from labeled data.
Algorithms include: Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines (SVM), Decision Trees, Random Forest.
Goal: Predict outcomes for new, unseen data.
narration: Supervised learning involves training a model on a dataset where the correct output or label is already known. The algorithm learns the relationship between the input features and the output labels. Common supervised learning algorithms include linear regression logistic regression support vector machines decision trees and random forests all aiming to predict outcomes for new unseen data based on the patterns learned from the labeled dataset.

title: Unsupervised Learning
content:
Learning from unlabeled data.
Algorithms include: K-Means Clustering, Hierarchical Clustering, Principal Component Analysis (PCA).
Goal: Discover hidden patterns and structures in data.
image_desc: Unsupervised learning clustering example. Type: diagram
narration: Unsupervised learning deals with datasets that lack predefined labels or target variables. The primary goal is to discover hidden patterns structures and relationships within the data. Algorithms like Kmeans clustering hierarchical clustering and principal component analysis are frequently used to group similar data points together or reduce the dimensionality of the dataset revealing underlying insights without prior knowledge of the desired outcomes.

title: Reinforcement Learning
content:
Learning through trial and error.
Agent interacts with an environment.
Goal: Maximize cumulative reward.
Algorithms include: Q-Learning, Deep Q-Network (DQN).
image_desc: Reinforcement learning agent environment interaction. Type: diagram
narration: Reinforcement learning is a type of machine learning where an agent learns to make decisions by interacting with an environment. The agent receives feedback in the form of rewards or penalties for its actions. Through trial and error the agent learns a policy that maximizes its cumulative reward over time. Algorithms like Qlearning and Deep QNetworks are commonly used in reinforcement learning to train agents to perform complex tasks.
